intro: Clidemia polyandra, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers, which are often pink or white, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Clidemia polyandra is also known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
